title: Brady List (January 2024)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brady List (January 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Ohio Electronic Sex Offender Registration and Notification Database report of Michelle Mathis (Ohio Bureau Of Criminal Identification And Investigation)

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Ohio Electronic Sex Offender Registration and Notification Database report of Michelle Mathis (Ohio Bureau Of Criminal Identification And Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the FOIA requests, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Ohio Open Records Law, §149.43 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records that detail the data/records on all sex offenders for life sentences within the timeframe of years 2011 through 2023. If that request of years is to complicated please reduce it a reasonable timeframe to the current date. 

I request a copy of any records/data held on all the identifiable sex offenders for years 2012 through 2023 on record for life sentences  to report at the Ohio Electronic Sex Offender Registration and Notification Database and/or at the Ohio Attorney General  and/or the Bureau of Criminal Identification and Investigation. If the request for the records/data has an  extensive timeframe you may narrow the search of the records/data of the sex offenders with life sentences to the years feasible to complete the request of FOIA and/or Privacy Act of 1974.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Ohio Supervisor of Public Record laws. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, or as the statute requires.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Sincerely,
 
Muckrock member services.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Michelle Mathis

title: School-Based Arrest Data Request

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: School-Based Arrest Data Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M. G. L.c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your department. Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE has expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection.
A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”
A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”
I request the following public records, as defined in M. G. L.c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):
1. An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). Specifically, we request an extract of the database to include the following columns:
a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement
b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement
c. Charge (or charges)
d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement
e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement
j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school.
k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and
l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable.
2. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each school-related arrest conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced).
3. Please provide an unduplicated count of arrested students for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced).
4. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced), per the U.S. Department of Education’s Civil Rights Data Collection for that year. For each referral to law enforcement, please include the school, demographic, and incident information described in DESE’s School Safety and Discipline Report Data Handbook v. 20.0.
5. Please also provide an unduplicated counts of referrals to law enforcement (as defined above) for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced).
6. A copy of any active memorandum of agreement and/or standard operating procedures between the police department and local school districts regarding police placement or activity in schools.
7. A copy of any active standard operating procedures developed with the police department and/or other law enforcement agencies regarding police placement or activity in your corresponding school; and,
8. Any records instructing or informing police personnel of, or otherwise describing, data reporting requirements and procedures for complying with M. G. L.c. 71 § 37P(b).
As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to determine whether your school district and police department are complying with their reporting obligations under the Criminal Justice Reform Act. “The public has an interest in knowing whether public servants are carrying out their duties in an efficient and law-abiding manner.”
It would be ill-advised to impose a fee for data that your department may have failed to report in violation of statutory and regulatory duty. Moreover, as you know, municipalities with a population of over 20,000 may not assess a fee for the first 2 hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs.

Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M. G. L.c 66, § 6A(d).
The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply. To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety.
If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me.

Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.

Sincerely,
Katherine Stathulis, Esq.
J.D. Fellow
Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration
k.stathulis@northeastern.edu
614.551.8426

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

MacKenzie Orcutt

title: Tracking of legal defense of police officers since 2022 (Seattle City Attorney)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Tracking of legal defense of police officers since 2022 (Seattle City Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Lists or spreadsheets compiling and detailing claims in which the City of Seattle defended Seattle Police Department staff, including specific parties named, resolution of suits, time and money dedicated to those defenses, etc., since January 1, 2022.  This should include records with information about claims and notices of claim targeting SPD staff regardless of whether lawsuit was filed, as well as amounts paid in related settlements or verdicts.

In case it's helpful in identifying records, please note that someone else received similar records from your office, covering 1998 through mid-2013 (PDR# 13-112) and 2013 through 2017 (PDR C017518-090117).  Those are all published on the Web at <https://www.muckrock.com/foi/seattle-69/city-attorneys-tracking-of-legal-defense-of-police-officers-6838/#files> and <https://www.muckrock.com/foi/seattle-69/city-attorneys-tracking-of-legal-defense-of-police-officers-since-2013-42688/#files>.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C150137-082923
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C150137-082923 received on August 29, 2023 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV23-C150137-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C150137-082923. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV23-C150137-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

title: RNL enrollment and financial aid models

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: RNL enrollment and financial aid models
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) All contracts with Ruffalo, Noel, Levitz (RNL) since Jan. 1, 2018 for enrollment management and financial aid optimization services.

2) All reports provided to the university by RNL since Jan. 1, 2018 regarding the following RNL services:
- Historical Research & Competitor Benchmarking
- Econometric Modeling
- Annual Financial Aid Plan Development
- RNL Smart View Dashboards & Reporting for Insight-Driven Response
- Retention Analysis
- Revenue Optimization & Simulation
- Four-Year Enrollment & Net Revenue Projection Model
- Enrollment Likelihood and FinAid Receptivity Scoring

3) All validation studies, differential impact studies, or comparable studies supplied by RNL or done by the university or a third party on the university's behalf regarding the accuracy of RNL's predictive models.

4) De-identified copies of all enrollment and financial aid model training datasets supplied to/received from RNL for 2021-2022 school year applicants, containing:
- All non-identifiable variables for each applicant that the university supplies to RNL for the purpose of building and training its predictive models
AND
- All output data fields (i.e., receptivity scores, lead categories, etc.) generated by RNL's predictive models for each applicant.

With regards to item 4 of my request, please note that I am asking for a de-identified data set that does not include fields that could be used to identify an individual applicant (e.g., name, address, SSN). These fields can easily be redacted by deleting those columns from the responsive spreadsheet.

I ask that all fees be waived as intend to use the requested records to further public understanding of public agencies and not for any commercial purpose. In the event you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation justifying the employee hours required to fulfill the request.

Should you choose to reject this request or redact portions of responsive documents, I ask that you provide a detailed breakdown of the statutory exemptions and associated case law underlying your decision to withhold each/any portions from public review.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Todd Feathers

title: Automated License Plate Readers (Hercules Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Automated License Plate Readers (Hercules Police Department)
communications.communication:
Dear Custodian of Records:

This letter constitutes a request under the California Public Records Act ("CPRA") from the Electronic Frontier Foundation, submitted with the assistance of MuckRock News. 

We request the following records related to Automated License Plate Readers ("ALPRs") and your law enforcement agency ("Agency").

Part A - Information related to ALPR data sharing.

A1. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data;
A2. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data;
A3. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hot list” information;
A4. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hot list” information.
The information requested in items A1-A4 is readily available for extraction through the ALPR software you use. For example, with Vigilant Solutions/Motorola Solutions, this data can be exported easily using the Data Sharing Report function. With Flock Safety, this information is available through the transparency portal function. Other software, such as BOSS, has similar functionality.  

Most agencies have encountered little difficulty in providing this information (see below). In a small number of cases, an agency has interpreted items A1-A4 as requesting the creation of a record that does not exist. We disagree: this data is maintained by your software, can be exported through software your agency has already purchased, and is therefore subject to CPRA. 

However, should you disagree, you may alternatively produce the following records:  

A5. All agreements, memoranda of understanding, requests, or other certifying documents that external agencies have signed to comply with Sec 1798.90.52(b) for accessing your agency's ALPR data. These documents are also often required under the "Releasing ALPR Data" subsection of a California law enforcement agency's SB 34 policy. 
A6. All agreements, memoranda of understanding, requests, or other certifying documents  that your agency has signed pursuant to Sec 1798.90.52(b) to access other agencies' ALPR data.
A7. All "records of access" required by Sec. 1798.90.52(a) for the periods January 1, 2021 until the date of processing this request. 

Items A5-A7 are not necessary if your agency provides the information requested in items A1-A4. We feel that items A1-A4 are more focused and would require less labor from your agency to produce. 

Part B - Information Related to Numbers of “Detections” (plate scans) and “Hits” (plate scans that matched to a hotlist)

B1. The aggregate number of "detections" collected during 2023.
B2.  The aggregate number of “hits” during 2023.

The information requested in items B1-B2 is readily available through the ALPR software you use. For example, with Vigilant Solutions/Motorola Solutions, this data can be exported easily using the Hit Ratio Report function. With Flock Safety, this information  is available through the transparency portal function. Other software, such as BOSS, has similar functionality.  As noted above, this information exists within your system and can be easily exported with existing software.

Part C - Assistance, Description, and Recommendations. 

We make the following requests under section 6253.1 of the California Public Records Act

C1. A description of  the information technology and physical location in which the records exist.
C2. Assist us identifying records and information that will help the public understand how ALPR data and hotlists are shared, how much data is collected year-to-year, and how much of that data matches a hot list; and 
C3. Provide suggestions for overcoming any practical basis for denying access to the information sought.

Please note that your agency provided substantially similar data in 2022. 

CPRA requires you to undertake reasonable efforts to locate responsive records and to work in good faith with requesters to respond to their request. See CYAC v. City of National City, 220 Cal.App.4th 1385, 1430 (2013). Thus under the CPRA you are obligated to conduct a reasonable search and cannot deny a request merely because it might generate a large volume of records. 

We ask that you please respond to this request within 10 days either by providing all the requested records or by providing a written response setting forth the legal authority on which you rely in withholding or redacting any document, as well as stating when documents will be made available. Should you choose to withhold or reject this request, we ask that you provide an explanation of why your agency is responding differently compared to the many others that have complied with our request. 

We also request that any records maintained in an electronic format be provided in that same format (such as a PDF, CSV or XLS file), to avoid copying costs.

However, should you be unable to do so, EFF will reimburse you for the direct costs of copying these records (if you elect to charge for copying) plus postage. If you anticipate that these costs will exceed $25.00, or that the time needed to copy the records will delay their release, please contact me so that I can arrange to inspect the documents or decide which documents I wish to have copied. Please also provide an invoice and a cost breakdown of the fee estimate. If the fees are less than $25.00, please copy and send the records and invoice as soon as possible, and we will promptly pay the required costs.

Thank you for your consideration of this request. If you have any questions or concerns, or if I can provide any clarification that will help identify responsive documents or focus this request, please do not hesitate to contact me at (415) 436-9333 x151 or dm@eff.org. You may also mail correspondence to the Electronic Frontier Foundation, 815 Eddy. St. San Francisco, CA, 94109.
                                               
Sincerely,
 
 
Dave Maass
Director of Investigations
Electronic Frontier Foundation

title: Clearview AI contracts and policies (Hope Mills Police Department)

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Clearview AI contracts and policies (Hope Mills Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Materials describing this agency's relationship with and use of products by Clearview AI, a face recognition company.

CONTRACTS AND AGREEMENTS
Any and all agreements related to the acquisition and use of this "software," algorithm, or program. This includes (but is not limited to):
• all contracts (as well as associated amendments, attachments, and exhibits)
• data sharing agreements
• insurance agreements
• intergovernmental services agreements
• licensing agreements
• memorandums of understanding, and
• nondisclosure agreements
• any relevant Requests for Expressions of Interest, Requests For Proposal (or equivalent calls for bids), responses to Requests for Expressions of Interest, letters of interest, responses to Requests for Proposal, sole source or limited source justification and approval documentation, documentation of selection, and other materials generated in the consideration and selection of the technology in question.

FINANCIAL and FUNDING MATERIALS
• Any records related to the financing or funding of this face recognition technology or system, including a copy of any related funding opportunity announcements, grant applications, grantor status/progress reports, purchase orders, invoices, and other memoranda and documentation related to the payment or cost (or lack thereof) of the face recognition technology or system, related technology, personnel, equipment, or other elements concerning this face recognition technology or system or program.

POLICIES, INSTRUCTIONAL, TRAINING, AND USE MATERIALS
• All instructional materials, presentations, and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance on the use of face recognition technology or system. This includes any notes taken during meetings that discussed the use of the software, any explanations (whether generated internally or externally) of how the face recognition technology or system works, and any other document that has been used to help explain the use of the face recognition technology or system to any party, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.
• This also includes training materials governing the use, sharing, or access to the face recognition technology or system or any data related to or collected by the face recognition software/technology, including the legal standard that is required before using the technology.
• Please provide a copy of any policies, policy directives, guidance documents, memoranda, training materials, or similar records governing the use and function of this technology for immigration, law enforcement, or any purpose, including all those related to data retention, permissible and impermissible use, and security standards. This would include materials that describe the application, function, and use of the face recognition technology or system, including advertisements, emails, handouts, usage policies, PowerPoint presentations, specification documents, or standard operating procedures.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

James Reno

title: Alerts (Springfield Police Department)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Alerts (Springfield Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

- Any emails, memos, or notification reports sent to the company SoundThinking (formerly shotspotter). These are reports where personnel have reached out to Shotspotter for support, because the system failed to detect a shooting or misclassified an incident.  According to ShotSpotter, their best practices include steps to ensure that if police officers conclude the ShotSpotter alert was indeed a “false positive,” they report that the company to "keep track and take remedial steps to minimize false positives in the future".  I am looking for any such feedback given to ShotSpotter. 

- Any emails between department staff with the words "false positive" and "Shotspotter" or "shot spotter" or "sound thinking". Responsive records should be from 2018 until the date this request is processed.

-  Copies of all SoundThinking (Shotspotter) responses to aforementioned notification reports,  Responsive records should be from 2018 until the date this request is processed.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: FHWA interpretation of the MUTCD on the proprer choice of exit numbers (Missouri Department of Transportation)

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: FHWA interpretation of the MUTCD on the proprer choice of exit numbers (Missouri Department of Transportation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

(1) An interpretation of the Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices for Streets and Highways ("MUTCD") issued by the Federal Highway Administration of the U.S. Department of Transportation ("FHWA") to to the Missouri Department of Transportation ("MoDOT") regarding the proper choice of exit numbers.  This interpretation is referenced in MUTCD Request 2(09)-149, a change request submitted by the National Committee on Uniform Traffic Control Devices ("NCUTCD"), available at <https://ncutcd.org/wp-content/uploads/meetings/2019A/AttachNo10.18B-GMI-01-ExitNumbering-Approved.pdf>, on lines 37 through 38.

(2) The request (or requests) for interpretation submitted by MoDOT to FHWA regarding the proper choice of exit numbers, along with all supporting documentation accompanying the request (or requests) for interpretation, corresponding to the above FHWA interpretation of the MUTCD.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Harwood

communications.subject: RE: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: FHWA interpretation of the MUTCD on the proprer choice of exit numbers (Missouri Department of Transportation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am following up regarding my Missouri Sunshine Law request with the subject "FHWA interpretation of the MUTCD on the proprer (sic) choice of exit numbers".

This request was sent to your office on Monday, May 4, 2020.  Nevertheless, I have yet to receive the requested records or any acknowledgement of the receipt of my request.

Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response or if further clarification is needed.  Thank you for your help.

Sincerely,

Andrew Harwood

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R004579-051320
communications.communication:
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST, Reference #R004579-051320

Dear Andrew,

It appears that your email address within our database was incorrect so the correspondence sent to you on June 8, 2020, providing an update of your request did not process correctly.  We apologize for the inconvenience.

Attached you will find that update from June 8, 2020.  We are currently still searching for your records and will update you as soon as we have the information available.

Should you have any questions, feel free to contact me.

Thank you.

GARI LUTTRELL
Senior Paralegal
Missouri Department of Transportation
Central Office - Chief Counsel's Office
PO Box 270, Jefferson City, MO 65102

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST, Reference # R004579-051320 
Dear Andrew, 
Thank you for your request received by the Commission Secretary on 5/13/2020 10:24:26 AM for records regarding: Manual on Uniform Traffic Control Devices (MUTCD) 
This office has reviewed your request. 
In processing requests for documents that involve little staff research time (less than one hour), research fees are waived but on larger, more complex requests, we charge a $30.00 per hour professional research fee, a $15.00 per hour clerical fee, a $2.00 fee for each CD of data; and $0.10 per 8 ½” x 11” page copy fee. 
In response to your request, Missouri Department of Transportation staff has compiled records responsive to your request.  The cost for these records is as follows: 
For cost of research time for clerical staff. Charged in 15 minute increments.:  $1.25 
For cost of research time for professional staff.  Charged in 15 minute increments.:  $30.00 
Total: $31.25 
Please send a check payable to “Director of Revenue-Credit State Road Fund”, with “ORR No. R004579-051320” written in the memo section and mail to: 
Financial Services Division-Accounts Receivable 
Missouri Department of Transportation 
PO Box 270 
Jefferson City, MO 65102 
For a quicker payment option, you may choose to pay by credit card by following the directions in the attached flyer. You can now make online payments at www2.modot.org/fspay.htm. Please note that there is a convenience fee added to all credit card transactions as detailed in the flyer. (https://u8387795.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=tVZK-2BDMrxhcb-2BNvwVODlUGK3OEn6Mnl6joe5ZGacIZX8ghgR9yzANOKqIVG7IOSor15__Nub5ICv-2FvYXQcmguHhh-2BJ8vyNlrXad-2F5B8XULXMBJKHKFcotc5LFLnAO549cvKSQ3uDSEQKeoJU2th2AK2GVu4dGmhS-2Fcz7I0Baj4RZSrmUBGbEp1GPPV-2F7LNoJAwARTRrGql23EfbaDyke9EDBNdwqzzejlmAWGUCQZLVrmcieAp1K0ogsuwccY41-2Bzdr69X817qwOSQUkXkCMpTM9OlST0QdK-2FxidEcXgt0iwuL0i5XuI5YK04-2FMCYAsPZCVv4k3zQss-2FO-2FjHdxLSYbIIZ9iSvFfmVBrs2Zmz5wtZFgPOdolZZhmZLNhxvCnSa9BXrqIuObfFem7968DW5HQ6yNFULcHyoF3WshsjpEBihpue4FXiT9821hVKle9GLN3AH1-2Bs2qqIcxCtsWR9BiyrPUA-3D-3D)

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST, Reference #R004579-051320

Dear Andrew,
Our database does not reflect payment was received by Financial Services for this request.  Please provide me with the details of your payment (date, amount, how submitted – if you have a cancelled check or receipt for electronic payment) and we can track the payment for proper posting to your request.  Once I am notified that payment is received, I can release the records.

Thank you.

GARI LUTTRELL
Senior Paralegal
Missouri Department of Transportation
Central Office – Chief Counsel’s Office
PO Box 270, Jefferson City, MO 65102

title: Private Law Firms and Third Party Vendors (Federal Bureau of Investigation)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Private Law Firms and Third Party Vendors (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating or referring to the specific role of the “Sensitive Compartmented Information Facility” located within Washington, D.C. office of the private law firm Perkins Coie, or any private law firms or third party vendors in monitoring, surveillance, observation, questioning, interrogation, investigation, infiltration, and/or collection of information regarding any American individuals or groups, including any records relating or referring to how records about American individuals or groups have been, will be, or might be used.

All records relating to any coordination by, between or among the FBI, and the Washington, D.C. office, or any U.S. office of the private law firm Perkins Coie, Georgetown University’s Institute for Constitutional Advocacy and Protection (ICAP), or any private law firms or third party vendors, including any orders agreements, or instructions relating in any way to Joint Terrorism Task Force activities that include the monitoring, surveillance, questioning, interrogation, and/or investigation of individuals or organizations on the basis of organizational membership, political views or affiliation, or participation in protest activities related to January 6, 2021, or other protest activities or demonstrations.

All records relating to any coordination by, between or among the FBI and the Washington, D.C. office, or any U.S. office of the private law firm Perkins Coie, Georgetown University’s Institute for Constitutional Advocacy and Protection (ICAP), or any private law firms or third party vendors, including any orders agreements, or instructions relating in any way to Joint Terrorism Task Force activities that include the monitoring, surveillance, questioning, interrogation, and/or investigation of individuals or organizations in preparation for demonstrations that would occur at the United States Capitol on January 6, 2021, that include the names of organizations or individuals involved in protesting the results of the 2020 presidential election, or other related activities, demonstrations or protest activity.

All records relating to the monitoring, surveillance, observation, questioning, interrogation, investigation, infiltration and/or collection of information about American individuals or groups in connection with meetings or assemblies at or near the United States Capitol, in the months leading up to, during, and after January 6, 2021, within the “Sensitive Compartmented Information Facility” of the private law firm Perkins Coie Washington, D.C. office, Georgetown University’s Institute for Constitutional Advocacy and Protection (ICAP), or any private law firms or third party vendors.

All records relating to any database within the “Sensitive Compartmented Information Facility” of the private law firm Perkins Coie Washington, D.C. office, Georgetown University’s Institute for Constitutional Advocacy and Protection (ICAP), or any private law firms or third party vendors, used for law enforcement or domestic surveillance or monitoring purposes, or for maintaining information that includes the names of organizations or individuals involved in protesting or speaking out against the results of the 2020 presidential election, demonstrations or other related protest activities. 

The term “records” includes all records on communication preserved in any form, including: correspondence, documents, data, e-mails (including all attachments and history), text messages, web searches (including search histories), audio/visual tapes, faxes, files, guidance, analyses, notes, procedures, rules, manuals, and technical information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Haley McLean

# Non-Individual FOIA Request

Request Information

    
    
    Please See attachment for description.

** 

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBIâ€™s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBIâ€™s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the â€˜Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request toolâ€™ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

title: transcript costs

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: transcript costs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records of the total amount paid by OCA in each year since 2016 for court transcripts and the number of transcripts ordered (total number and number of pages)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Mellins

This e-mail responds to your correspondence dated  12/28/23 which pursuant to FOIL, requested:

Records of the total amount paid by OCA in each year since 2016 for court transcripts and the number of transcripts ordered (total number and number of pages)
Attached please find records responsive to your request for “Records of the total amount paid by OCA in each year since 2016 for court transcripts.”

Please note, in response to your request for “the number of transcripts ordered (total number and number of pages),” the Office of Court Administration has conducted a diligent search of available records and has not located any records responsive to your request.


No records responsive to your request are withheld or redacted pursuant to any provision of FOIL, and your request is now considered closed.

title: Annatoyn NextEra

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Annatoyn NextEra
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all written or electronic communications, including email attachments, between Travis Annatoyn and any officials, lobbyists, representatives or other staffers affiliated with NextEra Energy, the renewable energy company. This request also seeks all written or electronic communications sent or received by Travis Annatoyn that contains one or more of the following key words or phrases: "NextEra", "MBTA', "bald eagles" and/or" golden eagles". This request seeks records produced since January 20, 2021. 

I am a reporter with The Guardian, The Nation and other outlets.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jimmy Tobias

title: Audio and all notes relating to Call 23017731 and other calls in vicinity of Carpenter Wilderness / 1050 Lebanon Road to January 2020 in Cortez, Colorado

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Audio and all notes relating to Call 23017731 and other calls in vicinity of Carpenter Wilderness / 1050 Lebanon Road to January 2020 in Cortez, Colorado
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Audio sound file / transcript and other notes resulting from the call made  to Cortez PD concerning Call 23017731. 

Please provide details and records on any other calls, investigations, reports, logs, notes, bookings or contact reports, complaints or other data for Police Department or Sheriff's Office to the Carpenter Wilderness trailhead area, the addresses adjacent to or bordering 1050 Lebanon, or responses that were made within 400 yards either side. This should extend back to January 2020 from the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Jeter

communications.subject: Records Request
communications.communication:
Attention Charles Jeter.
Regarding your records request, I have attached our records request form.
As soon as I get the filled-out form back I can email you those calls/reports.
Am I understanding your request correctly that you are also wanting the calls/audio that went to our dispatch center? If so, please put that on the form as well. Just so you are aware I believe calls/audio records only go back 3 years.
Thanks,

Taylor Marsell

Records Technician

City of Cortez

608 N. Park St.

Cortez, CO  81321

Ph: 970-565-8441

www.cortezco.gov<http://www.cortezco.gov>

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Audio and all notes relating to Call 23017731 and other calls in vicinity of Carpenter Wilderness / 1050 Lebanon Road to January 2020 in Cortez, Colorado
communications.communication:
Thank you Taylor. I appreciate your amplification on the call matter. Let's separate this slightly more to make it easier. 

1. Call 23017731 - Please provide details and records on any other calls, investigations, reports, logs, notes, bookings or contact reports, complaints or other data for Police Department or Sheriff's Office to the Carpenter Wilderness trailhead area, the addresses adjacent to or bordering 1050 Lebanon, or responses that were made within 400 yards either side.

2. Aside from the above call, please provide details and records on any other calls, investigations, reports, logs, notes, bookings or contact reports, complaints or other data for Police Department or Sheriff's Office to the Carpenter Wilderness trailhead area, the addresses adjacent to or bordering 1050 Lebanon, or responses that were made within 400 yards either side. This should extend back to January 2020 from the present, or as much archive as you typically maintain.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.  The law states, Section 24-72-205 (5) (a), C.R.S., (a) A custodian may charge a fee not to exceed twenty-five cents per standard page for a copy of a public record or a fee not to exceed the actual cost of providing a copy, printout, or photograph of a public record in a format other than a standard page; except that a custodian shall not charge a per-page fee for providing records in a digital or electronic format. I would request that these be provided in digital format via the Muckrock request rather than printed out. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Jeter

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Audio and all notes relating to Call 23017731 and other calls in vicinity of Carpenter Wilderness / 1050 Lebanon Road to January 2020 in Cortez, Colorado
communications.communication:
Thank you Taylor. I appreciate your amplification on the call matter. Let's separate this slightly more to make it easier.

1. Call 23017731 - Please provide details and records on any other calls, investigations, reports, logs, notes, bookings or contact reports, complaints or other data for Police Department or Sheriff's Office to the Carpenter Wilderness trailhead area, the addresses adjacent to or bordering 1050 Lebanon, or responses that were made within 400 yards either side on or around that date and time.

2. Aside from the above call, please provide details and records on any other calls, investigations, reports, logs, notes, bookings or contact reports, complaints or other data for Police Department or Sheriff's Office to the Carpenter Wilderness trailhead area, the addresses adjacent to or bordering 1050 Lebanon, or responses that were made within 400 yards either side. This should extend back to January 2020 from the present, or as much archive as you typically maintain.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. The law states, Section 24-72-205 (5) (a), C.R.S., (a) A custodian may charge a fee not to exceed twenty-five cents per standard page for a copy of a public record or a fee not to exceed the actual cost of providing a copy, printout, or photograph of a public record in a format other than a standard page; except that a custodian shall not charge a per-page fee for providing records in a digital or electronic format. I would request that these be provided in digital format via the Muckrock request rather than printed out.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Jeter

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Audio and all notes relating to Call 23017731 and other calls in vicinity of Carpenter Wilderness / 1050 Lebanon Road to January 2020 in Cortez, Colorado
communications.communication:
This sentence was somehow omitted in my correction. 

The audio for Call 23017731 should in fact be included as well as any officer camera footage, as well as any audio from calls made on the same issue or in the same vicinity during the same 24 hour period. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Jeter

communications.subject: Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Audio and all notes relating to Call 23017731 and other calls in vicinity of Carpenter Wilderness / 1050 Lebanon Road to January 2020 in Cortez, Colorado
communications.communication:
A couple more questions. You state "Aside from the above call, please provide details and records on any other calls, investigations, reports, logs, notes, bookings or contact reports, complaints or other data for Police Department or Sheriff's Office to the Carpenter Wilderness trailhead area, the addresses adjacent to or bordering 1050 Lebanon, or responses that were made within 400 yards either side. This should extend back to January 2020 from the present, or as much archive as you typically maintain." are you requesting every single record we have at those locations or just records related to a certain incident? If you are requesting every record that will take much longer than the 3 days as I will have to go through each record individually.
If your requesting records for a certain incident, do you have names/parties involved that could make this request easier to complete?
Thanks,

Taylor Marsell

Records Technician

City of Cortez

608 N. Park St.

Cortez, CO  81321

Ph: 970-565-8441

www.cortezco.gov<http://www.cortezco.gov>

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Audio and all notes relating to Call 23017731 and other calls in vicinity of Carpenter Wilderness / 1050 Lebanon Road to January 2020 in Cortez, Colorado
communications.communication:
Hi Taylor, 

Thank you so much for the patience and detail oriented attention to this request. IF we could get the first part of the request accomplished, the second one is fine to take more than three days, particularly during the holiday period we are entering. 

1. Call 23017731 - Please provide details and records on any other calls, investigations, reports, logs, notes, bookings or contact reports, complaints or other data for Police Department or Sheriff's Office to the Carpenter Wilderness trailhead area, the addresses adjacent to or bordering 1050 Lebanon, or responses that were made within 400 yards either side on or around that date and time. -- this one is important, and yes I would like a copy of the audio and if there was any officer camera footage, please archive that and let me know the cost. 

2, This call may have occurred the same day from multiple parties, or there may have been other complaints filed nonemergency which is why I wanted other information about the vicinity geographically about the park. Because there is a potential for Carpenter Trails to be considered an 'attractive nuisance' I was curious about establishing a baseline of complaints and complaint types for the vicinity of the trailhead, the park, and also the 1050 Lebanon Rd. address. I am familiar with geofencing and use of ArcGIS / QGIS for establishing a query based on geography so I requested a buffer around the park of 400 yards for the calls. It's perfectly okay for this part of the FOIA / CORA to take longer than three days, and in fact, I would say that I expect to hear "The Cortez Police Department is extending the time to respond to this request due to the extenuating circumstances of searching for the data requested through a geographical reference method across several years in time..." with an estimate if possible to set expectations.

 So, for part 2 no issues with it taking a reasonable amount of time to research. With part 1, if we could expedite the audio recording of the initial call in from Rachael Marchbanks on April 29, 2023,  Call 23017731, I would be ever so grateful because it would expedite my research and query into the matter. It's okay to provide updates as they come in rather than simply await it all to be aggregated, in fact I would appreciate it being provided via digital as you obtain it. 

Thanks in advance, 

Charles Jeter

communications.subject: Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Audio and all notes relating to Call 23017731 and other calls in vicinity of Carpenter Wilderness / 1050 Lebanon Road to January 2020 in Cortez, Colorado
communications.communication:
Charles,
I have attached the Cortez Police Department's request for records form again. I do need that form filled out before completing any requests you have.
Please include on our request form that you are needing dispatch audio/calls and officer bodycam, along with call notes/reports.

For the first part of your request, I can get you the call notes/report as soon as I get our request form back. The audio and bodycam request will go to the dispatch supervisor and patrol secretary, again, as soon as I get the form back, I will get the request sent to them.

I will get back with you next week regarding the second part of your request.
Thanks,

Taylor Marsell

Records Technician

City of Cortez

608 N. Park St.

Cortez, CO  81321

Ph: 970-565-8441

www.cortezco.gov<http://www.cortezco.gov>

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Audio and all notes relating to Call 23017731 and other calls in vicinity of Carpenter Wilderness / 1050 Lebanon Road to January 2020 in Cortez, Colorado
communications.communication:
Hi Taylor, 

I reviewed the form with MuckRock, the nonprofit outlet that I am processing these requests through. If this has nothing to do with an accident report, would the policy preclude omitting the requestor's personal identifiers such as DOB and Driver's License? Please check on this to ensure that there is no statute that precludes release of information to media without personally identifiable information also being released of the requestor. 

If we are able to eliminate this requirement, I can get MuckRock to finish the form fillout and we can proceed. 

Thanks, Merry Christmas, 

Charles

communications.subject: Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Audio and all notes relating to Call 23017731 and other calls in vicinity of Carpenter Wilderness / 1050 Lebanon Road to January 2020 in Cortez, Colorado
communications.communication:
Charles,

Attached is CAD 23017731.  I have sent your request for the call recording for that CAD to Lori Johnson who is the Dispatch supervisor.

As for the rest of your request I expect getting the rest of your information to take approximately two hours. There is no fee for the first hour, every hour after that the fee is $33.13. We do take credit card over the phone. You can call me at 970-565-8441 to process the payment and I will get to work on your requested information.

Please reach out if you have any further questions or requests.
Best,


Taylor Marsell

Records Technician

City of Cortez

608 N. Park St.

Cortez, CO  81321

title: Count of City Keys Issued in December, 2023

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Count of City Keys Issued in December, 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show the number of CityKeys issued from December 01, 2023 to December 31, 2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg

title: Deer Population in each NC County

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Deer Population in each NC County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The deer population in each county across the state of North Carolina.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Joshua Conner

communications.subject: RE: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Deer Population in each NC County
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following North Carolina Public Records Law request, copied below, and originally submitted on Feb. 8, 2020. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: Deer Population in each NC County
communications.communication:
To whom it may concern, 

I wanted to follow up on my previous request for the deer population in each county across the state of North Carolina. 

Thank you for your time and help, and I look forward to your response.

Thanks,

Josh Conner

title: Campaign Contributions and Council Proposal Documents (Jupiter Police Department)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Campaign Contributions and Council Proposal Documents (Jupiter Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

A current financial spread sheet for the projected costs/budgets for the Jupiter Fire Department and also attached any PowerPoints, spreadsheets including other original documents such as proposed contracts presented during the town council meetings. 
Please also include our current contract with Palm Beach County Fire Rescue.

Secondly I would like a detailed document of all campaign contributions for the current Council members including dollar amount and the origination (name) of the contributions.


There should not be any fees associated pertaining to this request, I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment as per Sunshine Law.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Mason C. turner

title: Open Records Request: Fusus Materials

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Open Records Request: Fusus Materials
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all internal training materials for the use of Fusus products.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

e

title: San Francisco Complaints/Settlements Related to 2020 Protests

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: San Francisco Complaints/Settlements Related to 2020 Protests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of lawsuits that details police misconduct brought against the city's police officers and/or the department by civilians or protesters who were injured during the 2020 George Floyd Protests from May 2020 to December 2021.

Copies of settlements that details the amount that plaintiffs who were injured by police during the 2020 George Floyd Protests received.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brianna Knibbs

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: San Francisco Complaints/Settlements Related to 2020 Protests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following California Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Dec. 4, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: San Francisco Complaints/Settlements Related to 2020 Protests
communications.communication:
Dear requester,

I am responding on behalf of the City Attorney’s Office to your below records request. Please note that we are invoking an extension of time under Government Code section 7922.535(c)(2) due to the need to search for, collect, and appropriately examine a voluminous amount of separate and distinct records, as well as the need to coordinate with different departments. We will endeavor to process your request as quickly as possible and anticipate providing a further response no later than December 28, 2023.

Please send replies to cityattorney@sfcityatty.org<mailto:cityattorney@sfcityatty.org>
Best,

[image010]Elizabeth A. Coolbrith
Paralegal
Office of City Attorney David Chiu
www.sfcityattorney.org

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: San Francisco Complaints/Settlements Related to 2020 Protests
communications.communication:
Dear Requester,

Apologies for the delay. I am responding on behalf of the City Attorney’s Office to your below records request. The disclosable responsive records have been sent to you via FTP. Please see instructions below. Please note that we have withheld communications covered by attorney-client privilege (Cal. Gov’t Code §§ 7927.705, 7930.110; Cal. Evid. Code § 954) and attorney work product (Cal. Gov’t Code §§ 7927.705, 7930.110; Cal. Code of Civil Pro. § 2018.030), as well as responsive records that were filed under seal and covered under Penal Code sections 832.5, 832.7, and 832.8 and Evidence Code section 1040.

FTP Instructions:
You will be receiving an email from CCSF SFTP NO-Reply (no-reply@sfgov.org<mailto:no-reply@sfgov.org>) with a link to the responsive records. For best results, use Microsoft Edge internet browser. Please check your junk mail folder if you do not see the email in your inbox. Below are download instructions:



Guest Folder Files Download:

1.         Open the CCSF SFTP No-Reply email, click on View folder button.

2.         SFSecureShare will prompt to Register a new account or Guest Login if you have an existing account.

3.         After logging in, check box next to the folder files.

4.         Select Download button to download the files.



*The shared folder will expire on 12am 01/28/2024.

Please send replies to cityattorney@sfcityatty.org<mailto:cityattorney@sfcityatty.org>.


Sincerely,

[signature_540561676]Odaya Buta-Scott (she/her/hers)
Office of City Attorney David Chiu
odaya.buta@sfcityatty.org<mailto:odaya.buta@sfcityatty.org>, www.sfcityattorney.org<http://www.sfcityattorney.org/>
Find us on: Facebook<https://www.facebook.com/sfcityattorney/> Twitter<https://twitter.com/SFCityAttorney> Instagram<https://www.instagram.com/sfcityattorney/>

This message and any attachments are solely for the intended recipient and may include privileged or confidential information. If you have received this communication in error, please notify me immediately, and permanently delete this message and any attachments. Thank you.

title: Pickleball (Parks and Recreation Commission)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Pickleball (Parks and Recreation Commission)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all written or electronic communications, including attachments, between your department and members of USA Pickleball, (@usapickleball.org). This request seeks documents created between January 1, 2020 and the date this request is processed.

- Any emailed or formal complaints containing the word "pickleball." Please search between January 1 and the time this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jason Koebler

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Pickleball (Parks and Recreation Commission)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on July 21, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: PRR-2023-089 Koebler
communications.communication:
Good morning Jason,

The Records Office at Washington State Parks and Recreation Commission has received your request regarding all communications/complaints related to “pickleball” as well as communications between Parks and members of USA Pickleball, (@usapickleball.org) between January 1st, 2023 to present.

Due to current workloads, I am providing an estimated production date of Friday, August 25th, 2023. I will notify you if that timeline should change.

Please let me know if you have any questions, I hope you have a great day!

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9BF9C.F529C8E0]

Nicole Peterson (She/Her)
Program Specialist 3
1111 Israel Rd. SW, Tumwater, WA 98513
p. 360-902-8522 | e. nicole.peterson@parks.wa.gov<mailto:nicole.peterson@parks.wa.gov>
parks.wa.gov<http://www.parks.wa.gov/>
Follow us: Twitter<https://twitter.com/WAStatePks> | Facebook<https://www.facebook.com/WashingtonStateParks/> | Instagram<https://www.instagram.com/wastatepks/>

communications.subject: FW: PRR-2023-089 Koebler
communications.communication:
Good morning Jason,

I have been working on your request and just wanted to ask for some clarification regarding the second part of your request where you state:

“Any emailed or formal complaints containing the word "pickleball." Please search between January 1 and the time this request is processed.”

I want to make sure if you are asking for just records from January 1, 2023 till the date your request came in (July 25th, 2023) , or if you are seeking from January 1st, 2020 as stated in the 1st part of your request?

I have done a search from 2020 and it seems that there is a substantial amount of emails that will take quite some time to review and provide for this request so I just want to make sure that we process this request correctly.

Please let me know if you have any questions, I hope you have a great day!

Respectfully,
[cid:image001.png@01D9BF9C.F529C8E0]

Nicole Peterson (She/Her)

title: 2023 Chicago Water Service Line Inventory

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: 2023 Chicago Water Service Line Inventory
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Please provide a list of all building addresses with public and private side service line material result, in an electronic data table if possible, that are included in the Chicago Department of Water Management's Water Service Line Inventory (https://sli.chicagowaterquality.org/) as of December 7, 2023.

If addresses are not available due to privacy reasons, please provide the list anonymized at the block level with accompanying ZIP Code, Community Area, and Ward if possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Feliciano Ocegueda

title: Paul Howard Johnstone

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Paul Howard Johnstone
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to or mentioning Paul Howard Johnstone, who the FBI have already disclosed having records on (see attached document). I request that a cross-reference search be conducted with Daniel Ellsberg, Pentagon Papers, and Vietnam Task Force Study.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best
